race.name: Coast to Coast
race.tagline: Michigan ultra-distance crossing from Lake Huron to Lake Michigan.

vitals.start_time: Early morning start (204-mile requires day/night riding)
vitals.aid_stations: Multiple aid stations for ultra distance

climate.description: June conditions with potential for heat. Day/night riding for 204-mile option.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads across lower Michigan. Relatively flat to rolling terrain with moderate elevation overall.
features: State crossing (Lake Huron to Lake Michigan)

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional ultra-distance event. 204 miles is serious challenge but regional field and infrastructure.

biased_opinion.summary: Coast to Coast offers a genuine ultra-distance challenge—204 miles crossing Michigan from Lake Huron to Lake Michigan. The 100-mile loop option provides a more accessible alternative. It's a well-organized regional ultra event with good support, but the field is regional and the terrain is relatively flat Michigan gravel. The adventure of crossing the state is the main appeal.
weaknesses: Relatively flat terrain (less challenging than mountain ultras)
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional ultra-distance gravel race with the unique appeal of crossing Michigan. The 204-mile option is a serious challenge, though the terrain is less demanding than mountain ultras. Worth it for Michigan cyclists or those seeking an ultra-distance challenge in the Midwest. Not a destination race for distant travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: Regional Michigan ultra-distance crossing the state from coast to coast.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Michigan or the Midwest and want an ultra-distance challenge—yes, it's a well-organized event with unique appeal. If you're traveling from far away—there are more prestigious ultra-distance events elsewhere.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better ultra-distance: Unbound XL (Kansas), Dirty Kanza (Kansas), Trans Iowa. For similar regional ultras: other Midwest ultra-distance events.

logistics.airport: Detroit (DTW) or Grand Rapids (GRR) - varies by start/finish
logistics.lodging_strategy: Au Gres (start) and Ludington (finish) have lodging. Book early. Shuttle logistics for 204-mile.
logistics.food: Stock nutrition for ultra distance. Aid stations provided.

history.origin_story: Ultra-distance gravel event crossing Michigan from Lake Huron to Lake Michigan.
history.reputation: Growing regional ultra-distance event in Michigan.

course_description.character: Relatively flat to rolling Michigan gravel crossing the state.

suffering_zones.label: First Quarter
suffering_zones.desc: 50 miles in, settling into ultra pace.

non_negotiables.why: 204 miles requires extensive endurance base and ultra-distance preparation.
204-mile option requires riding through the night with lights and navigation.
Ultra-distance success depends on conservative pacing and not going out too hard.

marketplace_variables.race_hook: 204 miles crossing Michigan from Lake Huron to Lake Michigan.
marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional ultra-distance challenge with 100-mile loop option.
